job_title: Caregiver in Reno, NV
pros: Helping people who are enabled differently
cons: Good company to work for

job_title: Care Services in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Providing care to patients and their families at a difficult time in their lives, co-workers
cons: Since Hope was acquired by Chapters Healthcare in Tampa, the culture has changed for the worse. Employees have been slowly made aware of how poorly the company had been managed by former management. Hope is trying to get their finances improved at the expense of laying off large numbers of staff and adding more job responsibilities to those who are left. Company-paid health insurance is no longer a benefit and mileage reimbursement was cut by 0.12/mile. Morale is low as co-workers are leaving with no one being replaced. Staff is being assured that things are improving but we are not seeing it!

job_title: Staff RN in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Caring for the patients and their families. Some co-workers.
cons: Since they nearly went out of business, Hope Hospice/Healthcare affiliated with Chapters Healthcare from Tampa. Now cutting staff and reducing all benefits. Be ready to do the work of 3 people. No overtime allowed. Rarely a staff meeting, and if there is one it's done via Zoom and management turns off your microphone so you have no input. They closed down the cafeteria in all inpatient units, so patients get frozen meals and will not serve staff. Paid mileage rate decreased by 12 cents for those who do home/facility visits.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Company has been progressively getting worse for its employees over past year. Unrealistic expectations for staff nurses to deliver quality care with increase of census and skeleton crew, it used to center around patient and truly making them comfortable at EOL with extra time to spend with grieving families now there is more time on computers and less time with patients
cons: See above always centered on signing up new patients whether or not they are truely hospice appropriate, tripled cost of insurance recently with new takeover byChapters health

job_title: Hospice Chaplain in Cape Coral, FL

cons: I do not have any negative issues

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: There’s no room for fault when it comes to end-of-life care. Hospice is a time of comfort and reflection for patients and their families. Hope Healthcare goes above and beyond to provide arguably the best hospice care the industry has to offer.
cons: There is no cons. I’ve sense moved on to other opportunities.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Benefits, flexibility, support, on-site pharmacy
cons: Completing admissions while managing caseload

job_title: in Cape Coral, FL
pros: Good group of caring people to work with. When I worked with them they had alternative methods of palliative management such as message therapy, aroma therapy. There is emphasis on education and all charting is to electronic health record. Their pay is comparable to other hospices.
cons: Like any 24/7 healthcare service have to work some weekends. They primarily work with Hospice patients either in their homes and there is a hospice house. If working in the home there will be constant daily travel. If working in hospice house just like any other subacute care with daily admission, discharges along with patient care. Anyone having a problem working with death or dying would not be suited to this position. It may take a while to get hired.

job_title: Inpatient Manager in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Medical and 401K Benefits are good.  It used to be a great place to work.
cons: A lot of bullying and back stabbing within upper management.  Sad to say but a lot of reverse discrimination.  HR will not deal with situations within a timely manner and leave lower Managers left with a lot of difficult situations.  They would rather push out the good workers than handle the difficult situations.  Instead of education and kindness shown to staff it seemed the upper management's way has changed to talking being backs and finding every avenue to dismiss the staff.  I am sad to say it is now a very unprofessional place to work.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Taking care of the people that are true hospice patients  yand the gratitude of the families when you know you have positively impacted someone at the most difficult time of their life
cons: Management thrives on creating toxic work environment within the facilities. “Unwritten rule” employees are not to become friends. Assignments rotated constantly to avoid consistency. Extremely political. Dedicated, long term employees fired with no valid reasons given. Selective enforcement of rules (some people have to follow, some don’t). Several staff over the years have been fired after being diagnosed with serious illness. Great benefits, but if you get cancer, odds are you get fired, so benefits don’t really help in that case. Administration very cold and unapproachable. All about the bottom line.

review_title: It’s a career not a job
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good job security during troubling times. This isn’t just a job where you come in to collect a paycheck each month. It’s a career path that you have to take seriously. If your primary goal is professional development then this may be the best place for you.
cons: High caseloads can put a strain on even the most experienced RNs. It’s no surprise that we struggle with high turnover because of the sheer amount of responsibility everyone has to deal with.

job_title: Director in Jacksonville Beach, FL
pros: Hospice provider that offers hospice and palliative care in patient homes, ALF's, SNF's and has 4 free standing hospice care centers. Hope provides pediatric hospice and palliative care for residents in SW Florida.
cons: Difficult and challenging job that requires that employees be self-directed in the process of learning how to provide care to at end-of-life.

review_title: Poor pay, poor management, too many mangers managing nothing
job_title: Team Nurse in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The Mission of the company, the patients and families are what make this job worth the cons.
cons: Poor pay, Mismanagement, poor employee treatment

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Very calm, soothing atmosphere. Plenty of community involvement. Several opportunities for patients and families to be educated on hospice care.  Staff is great to work with.
cons: Nothing comes to mind.  Employees are very friendly. Management listens to employees for new ideas. Great healthcare. Great benefits. Non micromanaging

review_title: Not a friendly place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Woodbridge, VA
pros: Definitely learned to define and hone my skills there and it put me in the position where I make more money than I ever have and can call my current job my dream job.
cons: Like most people say, if it wasn't for the patients they'd never be able to keep employees. Cannot understand how a workplace like a hospice would have managers lying and stabbing you in the back.

job_title: Social Services Counselor in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Long term stability, nice people to work with. Changing Healthcare can make it frustrating at time. Little supervision, or quality supervision.
cons: Not a lot of money or professional growth.  The days are overall about the same. After a while, it can become repetitive.

cons: It is complimentary to give employees coffee which is very very kind, but need better quality coffee w/ filtered water through the machines.
